summary: A comprehensive guide to digital note-taking using an iPad Pro and GoodNotes.

events_list.video_caption:
The video begins with a close-up of a tablet screen displaying handwritten notes, with the text "HOW I TAKE NOTES ON MY IPAD PRO" overlaid in white. A hand is seen interacting with the tablet, pointing at the notes. The scene transitions to a wider shot of the tablet placed on a white surface, surrounded by colorful pencils, a blue plush toy, and a green plush toy with a stitched face. The tablet is then shown in a black case, with the text "2017 10.5 INCH IPAD PRO" at the bottom. The tablet screen displays a lock screen with the time "4:12" and the date "Sunday, July 12," along with a background image of a cloudy sky and the text "(fading day)" at the bottom. The hand reappears, interacting with the tablet, and the scene concludes with the tablet still on the white surface, surrounded by the same plush toys and pencils.

The video continues with a close-up of the tablet on the white surface, displaying the same lock screen with the time "4:12" and the date "Sunday, July 12," along with the background image of a cloudy sky and the text "(fading day)" at the bottom. The surrounding objects, including the colorful pencils, blue plush toy, and green plush toy with a stitched face, remain in place. A hand appears, interacting with the tablet, and the scene transitions to the tablet being placed in a black case. The text "PROCASE IPAD PRO CASE" appears at the bottom of the screen. The hand adjusts the case around the tablet, and the video concludes with the tablet fully encased in the black case, still on the white surface, surrounded by the same plush toys and pencils.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with upbeat, pop-style music, creating a cheerful mood. A female speaker starts, her voice friendly and enthusiastic, announcing she'll show how she takes notes on her iPad Pro. She moves on to the hardware, mentioning her 2017 10.5-inch iPad Pro from Amazon renewed, priced at $350, and shares her experience checking it for damage. She highlights the Amazon's 90-day return policy. She then mentions a $12 basic iPad case with a folding magnetic screen, followed by the Apple Pencil. The music fades out.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a close-up of a person's hands holding an Apple Pencil, with a tablet and various plush toys in the background. The person demonstrates the pencil's features, pointing to its tip and the top part. The scene transitions to a close-up of the tablet's screen, where the person uses the Apple Pencil to draw on the screen, showcasing its functionality. The text "SUPERSHIELDZ MATTE SCREEN PROTECTOR" appears at the bottom, indicating the type of screen protector used. The person then compares the tablet's screen with another device, an iPhone, by holding both up side by side. The text "VIEW OF MY IPHONE CLASS SCREEN FOR COMPARISON" appears, emphasizing the comparison between the two devices' screens. The video concludes with a focus on the iPhone's screen, highlighting its clarity and smoothness.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a single female speaker with a positive and enthusiastic tone discussing an Apple Pencil. She highlights its durability, writing quality, comfort, and how a paper-like screen protector enhances the experience. The speaker notes that she orders all her products off Amazon and will leave the links below. The clip ends with a question: "So why digital note-taking?".

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a close-up of a hand flipping through a notebook filled with handwritten notes, highlighting the transition from digital to paper-based learning. The notes are densely packed with text, diagrams, and highlighted sections, indicating a thorough study session. The hand points to specific sections, emphasizing key points and demonstrating the use of the notebook for organizing and reviewing information. The camera then zooms in on a page with a yellow sticky note attached, containing a handwritten message that reads, "This is a reminder to review the material thoroughly before the exam." The sticky note serves as a visual cue for the importance of preparation and review. The video continues to showcase the detailed notes, with the hand pointing to various sections, reinforcing the focus on understanding and retention. The consistent background of the notebook and the hand's interaction with the pages create a cohesive narrative centered on the study process and the value of handwritten notes in learning.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a young female speaker discussing her note-taking methods at the beginning of university. She describes creating "really detailed, color-coded notes" and recording lectures to listen to at home. Her tone is calm and reflective. She continues discussing how she shifted away from taking notes by hand, noting that "writing by hand on paper also just takes a lot of time." She is speaking in a matter-of-fact tone. She praises the combination of typing speed with the benefits of hand-written notes for learning. She continues to say, "for apps, I use the app good notes to take all of my notes."

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a close-up of a tablet screen displaying a search bar, followed by a hand holding a stylus interacting with the tablet, which shows various folders and documents. The text "1. CONVENIENCE 2. SIMPLICITY" appears on the screen, emphasizing the ease of use and straightforwardness of the application. The scene transitions to a wider view of the tablet on a bed, surrounded by stuffed toys, with the word "ORGANIZATION" displayed, highlighting the app's organizational features. The video then shows a detailed view of the tablet screen, displaying folders and documents related to "biochem" and "exam one," with the stylus pointing to specific items, indicating the user's interaction with the content. The final frames focus on the tablet's document management interface, showcasing various folders and documents, with the stylus pointing to different items, demonstrating the user's navigation and selection process. The background remains consistent with a bed and stuffed toys, creating a casual and comfortable environment. The video effectively illustrates the convenience, simplicity, and organizational capabilities of the tablet application.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio features a single female speaker promoting an app. She mentions its price on the app store, then lists convenience, simplicity of the interface, and ease of organization as reasons to use it. She describes her organizational system of folders and subfolders for different classes, and states she keeps all class-related information on the app, avoiding switching between printouts and other programs.

events_list.video_caption: The video showcases a person using a tablet with a stylus to create a new notebook. Initially, the person types 'Simple Black' into the 'New Folder' dialog box, then switches to the 'New Notebook' dialog box, selecting 'Simple Black' and 'Squared Paper' templates. The person navigates through the 'App Preferences' menu, choosing 'Simple Black Notebook' and adjusting settings like 'Templates' and 'Paper Color.' The person then creates a new notebook with the selected settings, displaying a blank page with grid lines. The video concludes with the person using the stylus to draw on the notebook page, demonstrating the functionality of the chosen template. The background is a plain white surface, and the person is wearing a grey sweater.
events_list.audio_caption: A single female speaker begins the clip in a conversational tone, describing their preferences for taking notes in GoodNotes: they use a "standard notebook" with a brown cover and black binding, A5-sized gridded paper, and how the grid helps them write straight. The speaker adds that "A5 size is small enough" so the page doesn't seem overloaded. They mention not using the app's zoom feature because they don't always reach the end of the line, so the smaller page size is an alternative.

events_list.video_caption: The video showcases a person using a stylus to interact with a tablet, demonstrating various features and functionalities of a note-taking application. The individual, wearing a light gray sweater, begins by drawing a wavy line and writing lowercase letters 'abcdefg' on the tablet screen, with the text 'BALL PEN' appearing at the bottom. The scene transitions to the person writing 'fountain pen' and 'brush pen' next to the wavy line and letters, followed by 'ball pen' with a heart symbol, as the text 'PEN SIZE: 0.35 MM' is displayed. The person then draws a circle and writes 'black,' 'red,' and 'blue' in different colors, with the text 'COLOR' appearing at the bottom. The video continues with the person drawing three circles in blue, red, and purple on a grid background, with the text 'SHAPE' displayed at the bottom. The video concludes with the person drawing a wavy line and writing 'abcde' in lowercase letters, with the text 'LINE' appearing at the bottom. Throughout the video, the tablet is placed on a white surface, surrounded by various plush toys, creating a playful and creative atmosphere.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a single female speaker discussing her usage of the GoodNotes app for note-taking. She starts by listing the pens available in the app, mentioning her preference for the ball pen and explaining why she avoids the others. Her tone is casual and conversational as she elaborates on pen sizes and color choices for her notes, and the highlighter options she uses for important information. The only background audio is a quiet hum, that creates a simple ambient setting.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a person using a tablet with a stylus, surrounded by plush toys and colored pencils, indicating a study or creative environment. The person navigates through educational content on the tablet, focusing on topics related to amino acids, peptides, and proteins. The text on the screen includes headings such as "Amino Acids, Peptides, Proteins," "Learning Objectives," and "Most amino acids are chiral," with bullet points detailing key concepts. The person points at various sections of the content, highlighting specific information. The atmosphere is casual and educational, with the person's hand movements suggesting an interactive and engaging learning experience. The video transitions smoothly between different pages and sections of the educational material, emphasizing the fluidity and ease of navigating the content on the tablet.
events_list.audio_caption: A female speaker discusses how she takes notes, saying it "differs from class to class," depending on if the professor provides PowerPoints. She outlines how she writes directly on the PowerPoint itself, writes in a lecture-style notebook, or does not take notes at all. She explains that she doesn't feel the need to write down notes if she already knows the material, or the professor just reads from a PowerPoint. The speaker adds that she puts more effort into revising, but still emphasizes the importance of writing notes "that you understand." As she finishes speaking, there is a transition to upbeat, cheerful music.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a person using a tablet to take lecture-style notes. The individual, wearing a gray long-sleeve shirt, is seen holding a stylus and writing on the tablet's screen, which displays a grid paper background. The tablet is placed on a white surface, surrounded by various plush toys, including a blue one with a zipper and a green one with an 'X' for an eye. The text "LECTURE STYLE NOTES" appears on the screen, indicating the purpose of the activity. The person writes the word "genetics" on the tablet, followed by a small purple label with the same word. The video focuses on the process of taking notes, highlighting the use of digital tools for organizing and annotating information.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a woman speaking in a clear, instructional tone. She explains her note-taking system, starting with "it's really simple and it works for me." She goes on to describe writing the date in the upper right corner, mentioning it helps with revision and referencing when something was taught. She then says she usually writes the topic title at the top of the page and highlights or circles it.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a person using a stylus to write on a tablet screen, which displays a grid paper background. The individual, wearing a light gray sweater, is focused on writing notes about genetics. The notes include the word "genetics" highlighted in a purple box, followed by bullet points detailing the main concerns of the field, such as heredity, the genetic unit of heredity, and molecular segments of DNA that produce a product. The tablet interface shows various tools and options at the top, indicating that the person is using a note-taking or drawing application. The background is a simple, light-colored surface, possibly a bed or table, with a small portion of a colorful object visible on the left side. The video captures the process of writing and organizing information, emphasizing the educational or study-related nature of the activity.
events_list.audio_caption: A female speaker describes her note-taking system, explaining how she uses bullet points for general information, dashes for more specific information, and arrows for even more specific information, then restarts the cycle. She emphasizes that her simple system helps her remember signifiers and take clean notes without being overwhelmed.

events_list.video_caption: The video showcases a person using a tablet to take notes on various subjects, including genetics and calculus. The individual, wearing a light-colored long-sleeve shirt, is seen writing on the tablet with a stylus, surrounded by colorful pencils and plush toys, creating a cozy and creative atmosphere. The notes on the tablet are organized with bullet points and diagrams, highlighting key concepts in genetics and calculus. The person interacts with the tablet, pointing at different sections of the notes, indicating a thorough review or explanation of the material. The background features a white surface, possibly a bed or table, with additional plush toys and stationery items, enhancing the personal and relaxed setting. The video emphasizes the use of digital tools for studying and organizing information, with the person actively engaging with the content on the tablet.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features one female speaker describing their note-taking process. They mention highlighting important statements or essential information from PowerPoint presentations and pre-made notes. A second color is used to draw diagrams or add extra information for clarification. The speaker adds an asterisk to note specifically what their professor says will be on an exam. The speaker emphasizes they write this information in the form of a practice question so they can review later.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a person interacting with a tablet, surrounded by various plush toys and colored pencils, on a white bedsheet. The person, wearing a white long-sleeve shirt and a ring, is seen using the tablet to take notes and highlight text. The text on the screen reads "NOTES THAT DON'T WORK FOR ME," indicating a focus on ineffective note-taking methods. The person uses different apps and tools on the tablet, including a note-taking app with handwritten notes, a drawing app with a blue square, and a web browser displaying a webpage with text and images. The person also uses a stylus to interact with the tablet, highlighting and annotating the content. The video showcases the person's attempts to organize and understand the information on the tablet, with a focus on the tools and methods they use. The background remains consistent throughout the video, with the plush toys and colored pencils adding a playful and creative atmosphere to the scene.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a female speaker assessing her notes from a biology textbook, describing them as "basically useless" due to too much information. She continues by reflecting on how mnemonics, flashcards, or practice tests could have been better study methods than rote note-taking. She mentions transitioning to Anki flashcards for reinforcement and self-testing, finding it more practical and time-efficient. The speaker's tone throughout is conversational and reflective.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a person holding a tablet with handwritten notes on the screen, surrounded by plush toys. The notes cover topics such as 'embryogenesis + devel.' and 'yogenesis + devel.' The person uses a stylus to point at and highlight specific sections of the notes, which include diagrams and detailed explanations. The background is a soft, peach-colored surface, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere. The video transitions to a blank peach-colored screen, indicating a pause or break in the content.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip features a single female speaker with a friendly and conversational tone. She encourages viewers, emphasizing the importance of functionality in note-taking over mere aesthetics, and promises a video next week before signing off. The speech is set against the backdrop of upbeat, calming electronic music, creating a relaxed atmosphere.
